scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In these letters of Sinclair Lewis to Albert Hergesheimer, Lewis regrets he cannot offer financial aid or allow Hergesheimer to do a dramatization of "Elmer Gantry."

did.unittitle: Sinclair Lewis, New York, to Albert Hergesheimer, Evanston, Illinois, 1931 Dec 21

scopecontent.p: Lewis is unable to offer financial aid to this new writer but offers to send his name to publisher Harrison Smith who may be able to help him.

did.unittitle: Sinclair Lewis, Bronxville, New York, to Albert Hergesheimer, Chicago, Illinois, 1934 Jan 23

scopecontent.p: Lewis regretfully writes that it would be impossible for him to do a dramatization of Elmer Gantryas it was done within the past few years.
